title: E field at vertex of triangle

content.question: Two identical spheres each have a charge of <math alttext="positive 3.0 microcoulombs" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>3.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>Î¼</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and are held at vertices of an equilateral triangle with sides of length <math alttext="3 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mtext> m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown in the figure. Point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is at the third vertex of the triangle and <math alttext="2.6 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2.6</mn><mtext> m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> above the midpoint between the spheres. The magnitude of the electric field at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
